website_summaries.verdict: Kit represents a good value. Finish nailer has a comfortable design that you can use all day long.
pros: A 15-gauge angle finish nailer is part of the kit, along with 3 other power tools
Finish nailer provides adjustable nail depth that will meet the needs of various jobs
No-mar tips protect the surface of the piece of wood being nailed
Can adjust the direction of the air exhaust to keep it out of the operator's face
cons: Will suffer problems with nail jams

website_summaries.verdict: A comprehensive package of versatile tools that many owners appreciate.
pros: Owners get four tools in one
Accommodates a wide variety of nails and staples
cons: Because of the low price, some customers worry about durability
These worries rarely come to fruition

customer_reviews.title: Warranty covers nothing, oring blew after 25 nails.
customer_reviews.text: The stapler I've shot about 10 times, works well...so far. I shot about 25 nails through the 15ga and it blew an oring operating at 90psi. Not only that, I go to read the warranty only to find out they consider 90% of the parts under "normal wear and tear" so you are out of luck unless the body explodes. 7 year warranty is useless. Time to find my own parts and never use Freeman again.
customer_reviews.author: Jonnathan Raine

customer_reviews.title: Framing Made Easy For DIYers
customer_reviews.text: Five for a very resonable price. To date, have used 2 of 4 guns and both worked great. The big gun worked fantastically to frame up our new small cabin. However, for close-in nailing get a small palm nailer, as it will eliminate lots of difficult hand nailing. We even brought the stapler gun home from Alaska.
customer_reviews.author: DaveV

customer_reviews.title: Framing Nailer Jams to often and trigger seal broke on first day of use.
customer_reviews.text: I put about 20 nail cartridges though this before the trigger started leaking and the gun stopped working. During that time it jammed at least once pre nail cartridge and usually about every 5th nail. The kit looks to good to be true and unfortunately it is. Staple gun seems to be holding up ok and so to the finish nailer, so I'm not totally disappointed. Just a homeowner at this point so probably not going to go back to a Senco, but maybe something with a bit more quality like a porter cable....
customer_reviews.author: indoor racing

customer_reviews.title: Great for DIY, unbelievable good price
customer_reviews.text: I'm a homeowner, like most of the reviewers on here. I wanted this for a home project. I'd consider myself pretty handy (I've built beds/tables/etc). I've never used a nailgun before. I just completed a shed with these tools. They're awesome. I can't believe the quality for the price. I wish I had this before I paid someone to build my fence because I definitely could have done that with these nail guns. The framing nailer is pretty big. Definitely bulky. The Finishing nailer is much easier to use. I had a few misfires. Easy enough to fix. The stapler/brad nailer are very small (in a good way) and feel solid. I haven't needed them yet.
customer_reviews.author: unitmonster

customer_reviews.title: The tools are good the warranty is USELESS.
customer_reviews.text: 1 June 18: I've used the framer and finish nailer almost exclusively and they have worked flawlessly. I'm just a DYI'er so for me they are fine. Cant speak for these being used to earn a living. 16 Sept 19 update: The trigger on the framer blew out today. I attempted to use the 7 year warranty but apparently that only applies to anything that DOSEN’T MOVE on the framer. Everything that does move is only warranted for 90 days. THE WARRANTY IS USELESS. BEWARE.
customer_reviews.author: CountryLogic

customer_reviews.title: Four great guns for the price of one from most other brands
customer_reviews.text: Excellent products. Built a fence with the finish nailer and the brad nailer. Finish nailer went through over 1,000 nails with zero jams, misfires, or shorts. Used brad nailer on detail lattice and worked equally well. Super easy to set up and re-fill. Used with Husky 125psi compressor.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Worth it. 100%
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I wasted so much of my life, and so many remodeled rooms on nails and finish screws when this option was so inexpensive. There's complaints about jamming, guarantee you loaded it wrong or didn't get proper nails. Most finish nails at the stores are not the gage this takes. Dewalt has em at home depot. The 15g 34° finish. I use gun oil cause it's what I have handy, fee drops in the intake before I put the hose on. Been working right on through the house without issue. You need these. Every lady with any sense and ability needs these. Everyone deserves nail guns.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Fantastic

customer_reviews.title: Nice for home projects
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used Milwaukee, DeWALT, and Porter Cable nailers in the past, and these are very comparable. The weight and functionality are perfect for any “around the house” projects. They might not hold up to framing houses day in and day out, but for the price, any home project should be a breeze. I was hesitant just because I wasn’t familiar with the brand, but am very happy I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect. Bought these for my husband for Christmas last year and he is just starting to use them almost a year later. Had to wait until he had the right air compressor. So far he is very impressed and thankful for them since they do exactly what they were intended for. Highly recommend for anyone. They are so much better than a hammer and nails and easier to cover up the holes. We are in the process of remodeling our house and my husband is even redoing parts that had hammer and nails because the look is not as clean as it is using nail guns.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Used twice, body blew completely apart
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set back in 2015, but haven't had a need for it until recently. I used it the first time, all according to manufacturer's instructions (oil, pressure etc), with no issue. The second time I used it with the same exact conditions and the entire body of the gun blew completely apart! Luckily I wasn't injured, but this could have been very bad. I honestly don't feel comfortable using the other guns after that episode.
customer_reviews.author: FamilyMan

customer_reviews.title: Zero failures. Outstanding performance!
customer_reviews.text: I tested all of them and zero issues. I’ve primarily used the framing nailer this month using Grip Rite Prime Guard GR408HG1M 21 Degree Plastic Strip Round Head Exterior Galvanized Collated Framing Nails, 3" x 0.120". These nails have been outstanding!!! Zero jams and I’ve shot about 500 so far. I was building beams using 2 2x10s. The freeman will countersink them perfectly. Set your PSI to 110! It will be perfect! Don’t exceed 115 because that is the freeman safe limit. I’ve noticed some reviews stating that the nails don’t countersink. You have to adjust your PSI people!
customer_reviews.author: EE2009

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I need.
customer_reviews.text: The price actually made me nervous (you get what you pay for.. right?), but the price and reviews is why I ultimately bought the product. I could not be happier. Re-framed a rotted 2x6 wall, installed custom wainscoting and trim, used crown stapler to install backing for new pine wall behind bar. Thus far no problems..
customer_reviews.author: JScholtes

customer_reviews.title: Quality tools.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent equipment. I’ve put the framing nailer, finish nailer and stapler through the paces and they have performed flawlessly. Great value! The framing gun is a bit large-compared to the paslode cordless I use to have-but for the price difference I can live with it. I’ve shot a few thousand 1 1/4” and 3/4” staples without a single jam so far. Tried several brands of staples with no difference in performance. I was skeptical of this brand but so far very impressed and happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This was replaced replace in November.. but the ...
customer_reviews.text: This was replaced replace in November.. but the second nailer isn't working again..
customer_reviews.author: Wanda rice

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased so far.
customer_reviews.text: I have only owned these for a short time, but so far so good, and I'm very pleased with the product at this price point. I've used the 15g finish nailer and the 18g brad nailer so far and they work well. So far, no jambs and only 2 short fires that didn't go all the way in on the 15g nailer. No problems at all with the brad nailer. I'm optimistic that the framing nailer and narrow crown stapler will work similarly well, but I'll adjust my review later if I run into any trouble with either.
customer_reviews.author: G. Mickle

customer_reviews.title: Extremely satisfied with this purchase (although it went on sale at ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely satisfied with this purchase (although it went on sale at HomeDepot two weeks after I bought it online...) No jams, everything works, just remember to put a few drops of oil in the inlet before you start using it for the day, and use a nozzle to clean them out before you put them away. So far, I've used all four, and the quality is great. Sometimes I can't believe that the contractor brands sell a single framing gun for the cost of this whole set, but for the amount I use it (weekender DIY, porch redo, bookshelves, etc), this set really covered all of my bases. Plus, firing nails into things is just plain fun. Wear your goggles!
customer_reviews.author: xram

customer_reviews.title: The price was great, but the tools are just okay
customer_reviews.text: The price was great, but the tools are just okay. They're a bit finicky to load nails and to set depth. However I'm just a weekend warrior and the isn't being used for my profession. I had borrowed a 18 nailer from a neighbor that he bought at walmart and its as actually a bit easier to use etc.
customer_reviews.author: P. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Used these for re-attaching a lot of baseboards. the 15ga was great for the boards and the 18ga was great for the quater round. I did use the framing nailer a bit, it did jam very badly once and has miss struck a couple times. not sure if the loader was bad or the brand of nails is causing problems. Otherwise a solid set. biggest downside is the 18ga does not go up to full 2" nails. i might have been able to do all the boards with just that if it had longer nails.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: good easy  to  use and find nails for
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these when one of my older framing gun failed I ended up using only these guns to build a 2 story 3300sqft home 4 bedroom 3 bath 2 living areas no issues with any of the guns from framing or finish work purchased most of the nails from Amazon cheaper than I could locally very happy with the guns just purchased another set to have at my house as my son decided to keep the other set with his house
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have had no problems with them and I am happy with this set of air nailers
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an expert on air nailers, but these seem to work very well. I have had no problems with them and I am happy with this set of air nailers. I'm now wondering why it took me so long to buy them. UPDATE: I have had a chance to use these nailers. They are fairly lightweight, but don't feel cheap. They are pretty well balanced and are comfortable to use. The framing nailer is quite large (they all are) but surprisingly light. Still happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Good for weekend handy man
customer_reviews.text: Used nail gun extensively to build large storage shed. No jams, but a few dry fires occurred during use. Depth control is okay for the cost class of this unit. Used Grip Rite Nails from HD and they worked okay. Hoping other tools in kit work as well. Saved me a lot of hammer swings and was great when trying to do framing and roof trusses by myself. I used the single fire mode as I am not that skilled with nail guns.
customer_reviews.author: BLM

customer_reviews.title: framing nailer lasted one set of nails before the trigger ...
customer_reviews.text: framing nailer lasted one set of nails before the trigger quit working. gasket or something is gone. no air. get a lowes or hd nailer instead.
customer_reviews.author: MZ

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used the framing gun in the set, but it paid for itself in about half an hour. I was previously hammering with a framing hammer and it was punishment. Using this framing nailer is a pleasure. I was able to complete a project in about 20 minutes that would have taken me two or more hours the old fashioned way. And I wasn't completely spent afterward. It's not perfect and I wish it had the hanging clip some of the more expensive models have, but overall I am super-satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these guns in order to remodel a house that I rent out. For the price, I was very happy with them. The only issue that I had was that when there was about three to five nails left on a strip, the guns would act as if they were empty. This caused me to start wasting a lot of nails. However, I quickly realized that I did not need to throw out the old strips and instead just put a new strip in right behind the old strip with the three nails left. The guns would seemlessly use the old nails and transition into the new nails. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Works great, great value!
customer_reviews.text: Thus far I have used the framing nailer to frame a 1500 square foot basement. I've put about 2500 nails through it and I have had only a handful that didn't drive in flush. I look forward to using the others as my project progresses, but thus far I highly recommend this product. It's hands down the best value I was able to find.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality
customer_reviews.text: As a professional remodeler I should have known better then to buy this set. I wanted an extra set of nail guns to keep around the house for projects. First time I used the stapler it broke. The only reason I gave it 3 stars is because amazon replaced the entire set quickly. Havent had any issues with new set but definitely not even close to the quality of my Bostitch, DeWalt, and Porter Cable sets
customer_reviews.author: RFH

customer_reviews.title: Great nailers, awesome price.
customer_reviews.text: I have used all four of these tools multiple times. I recently had a problem with the framing nailer requiring a replacement part. I contacted Freeman Tool customer service and they not only rushed me a new part, they emailed me detailed instructions on how to replace it. I am very impressed with the tools and the awesome customer service. These are well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Donald R

customer_reviews.title: all good so far
customer_reviews.text: I have been doing a lot of maintenance, upgrades and repair work on an old home and found that much of the work I am doing is almost impossible to hold the material, and a nail and swing a hammer at the same time, especially while trying to maintain balance on a 10/12 pitch roof. Using a nail gun is the only way to go and I have had great results with these nail guns. I tested all of the guns upon arrival, I have used the stapler and framing guns a bit and so far all is well. Every time I use the framing gun I cant believe I went all my years with a hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good thing for Amazon's return policy
customer_reviews.text: The Finishing and brad guns both had a lot of trouble with sinking depth, even at 110+ PSI for the finishing gun, and it wasn't very consistent. I oiled as asked and took care of them carefully. One of the auto-bump switches broke the second time I used them. I didn't even get to use them all so I can't give 1 star, and maybe I got a bad set, but they were not good nail guns. Bought two new ones this morning, immediately worked on the same hose and compressor, same fittings with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Snow

customer_reviews.title: Incredible deal
customer_reviews.text: Amazing value for the money. I have used all 4 of the nailing guns on 3 different projects. All have worked flawlessly. I don't think there is any reason to spend more money for a DeWalt or Hitachi combo kit. The heavy duty carrying bag is just icing on the cake.
customer_reviews.author: chilipepper

customer_reviews.title: Have to turn air pressure higher than labeled
customer_reviews.text: The only way to drive a nail below the wood surface or even flush in many instances is to turn the nailers air pressure higher than the guns label says is the maximum. Other than that, I have used the 18 gauge and 15 gauge numerous time and have not had a nail jam yet. I like that all four guns fit into a nice nylon bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Only used the framing nailer so far
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Only used the framing nailer so far. Framed the entire basement and didn't have one jam. No issues at all. Put a drop of oil in each day before use as recommended by others and seems to keep it working perfectly. I got the set for a quite a bit cheaper than the $200 it's listed for now, but I would say it's worth it even at $200. Can't speak for the other nailers yet, but I will update this review as I have a chance to use them.
customer_reviews.author: walkyler

customer_reviews.title: Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I've used each gun multiple times. They work flawlessly, no problems and build quality is very high.
customer_reviews.author: King Detroit

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: Working great so far. I've used the finish nailer for trim inside and the framing nailer to assemble a shed. The framing gun will blank fire if the pressure isn't high enough. Plastic collated nails make a mess when you use them but I like the full headed nails. It will not fire if there are fewer than four nails.
customer_reviews.author: JR Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Excellent deal and product
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used all of the guns yet but the 2 guns I have used I was greatly surprised at the power, easy handling, light weight, and durability these guns have. 4 guns for the fraction of the cost of 1 gun, how can you beat that !!??
customer_reviews.author: C.H.

customer_reviews.title: It just works!!
customer_reviews.text: Built a barndo and my old nail guns gave out. I purchased this set and I have driven 14k nails with framing nailer with absolutely no issues. Staple gun has been really handy assembling bee hives and the finish gun worked awesome with the cabinets and crown molding highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Guy Woodward

customer_reviews.title: You can’t do better for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The collection of air tools cannot be best for the money. I’ve three of the four on an almost daily basis since I bought them and they’ve worked like a charm. The carrying satchel is awesome. Keeps them and their manuals and accessories together in a convenient, portable package.
customer_reviews.author: MarMar

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for light to medium duty use
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these nail guns for a few months now. No problems at all. These are not contractor grade - you wouldn't want to fire 1000's of nails per week through them. They are well built and priced right for occasional use. Recently built a 10x12 storage shed and fired 1500-2000 nails through the framing gun - no problems but it is heavy, your forearms will get a workout. Would not want to use this all day every day.... Overall, well worth the money. If you are going to be doing a lot of framing, go with a lighter framing nailer.... I paired these with the Makita MAC2400; works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Husker Fan

customer_reviews.title: Around the house and homeowner projects
customer_reviews.text: So far these have worked well for me. The framing nailer will jam if you let the magazine get down to about 1/3rd full. Other than that, no issues. Great for home projects, great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: william mcarthur

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Great product and superb customer service!!
customer_reviews.text: These work fabulous!! You can buy nails at Home Depot. Some are inside the store and some are in the tool rental department. I did have a problem with one of the nailing guns so I gave Freeman customer service a call. To my surprise someone in America quickly answered the phone and within 5 minutes had a suitable solution for me! The customer service rep even followed up with an email. Good service is so hard to find. I'm so happy I discovered this company! These tools are comparable, if not better than more expensive ones I've seen, but a far better price. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: Tam

customer_reviews.title: Good, but missing items and looked used.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a set a few years back. Worked great for the price. Since I moved, I left the older set at my sister's. So I bought a new set for my farm. Only complaint I have this time is, it never came as fully described. I never got the wrench or the oil that was supposed to come with it. Also had some scuff marks on the guns like it had been used before. Other then that, it's good. That's why im giving this set 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Used the framing nailer
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Used the framing nailer, so far too frame in my basement. It works excellently. Be advised, the other three are staple guns, not nails, or brads. I like staples, so no problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: macbabe

customer_reviews.title: Great Product Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe I got 4 guns for less than the average single gun. I'm not a contractor but I use them a lot and have never had a problem. If you're a DIY person this is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: B Mac

customer_reviews.title: The brad nailer is great. The rest of them work
customer_reviews.text: I've used these all these nail guns quite a bit over the last few months. The brad nailer is great. The rest of them work, and for the money, they are a good product. If I was a professional, I would buy something a little better quality.
customer_reviews.author: rodney hurst

customer_reviews.title: Great Air Nailers!
customer_reviews.text: Great set of air nailers!! I have used many "big name" brands that are not near this quality. I have used several brands of nails and these guns continue to fire without a problem. I have now shot over 1,000 nails through each gun, with the exception of the stapler. These are well built heavy duty guns. I would recommend to anyone that is in the market. In my opinion much better than the big name products at a much better price.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Nails that fit at a reasonable purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to find the right Degree angle of nails to fit guns. When you do Lowes. home depot. Harbor freight. Only carry the big boxes. Those nails will rust up before I could use them all.
customer_reviews.author: Mark P.

customer_reviews.title: ) The finishing nailer worked great, I have gone through about 3500 nails with ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall decent products. The framing nailer had a defective design in that it won't toenail properly (the end is to big, even with bumper removed), so I have to finish toenails up with a framing hammer. Other than that the framing nailer works well, and I haven't had trouble witht it. (So far have only gone through about 1100 nails.) The finishing nailer worked great, I have gone through about 3500 nails with it. I have not used the crown stapler or brad nailer yet.
customer_reviews.author: Perry B McCart

customer_reviews.title: Perfect set to give the crew
customer_reviews.text: The framing nailer and 15ga do the job well a little heavy but feel durable the 18ga Brad and narrow crown gun does not hold over 1 1/4" nails little disappointed didn't get to use them cause my nails were to long
customer_reviews.author: Houston

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Good price.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a couple of years now and it was well worth the money. As a residential remodeling contractor, it has everything I need to do the job fast and with excellent results. I've recommended this nail gun set to a few friends who are as happy as I am with it.
customer_reviews.author: ClementsB

customer_reviews.title: 3" nail into solid oak - easy!
customer_reviews.text: I do not know how I lived without it before. That is my first pneumatic tool and I LOVE IT! I used it so far for making furniture (oak and black walnut), nailing pine and oak boards with 3" nails. I also used brad nailer with 5/8" brads to affix tin panel to the ceiling. No problems whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Galant

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Performance and Value
customer_reviews.text: I was really only looking for a good dependable framing nailer to use in finishing my basement. The reviews for this combo kit were as good or better than for other brand name individual framing nailers and the price was much better as well. I have gone through hundreds of 3 inch framing nails with not a single misfire or jam. It has been working flawlessly. I have not yet used the other three smaller nailers. If they perform as well as the framing nailer, then this combo kit is an incredible value. It also comes with a large, sturdy fabric case. I would definitely recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Great value, sturdy nailer’s, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These were a great value for the money, right out of the box they worked as they should. Came with oil and instructions. All nailers were easy to load.
customer_reviews.author: P Owens

customer_reviews.title: Extremely good value for the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Back and forth on these. Mostly used the framing nailer. Second set I bought (first was stolen). Nails set inconsistently despite chanigng compressor or adjusting the gun. Extremely good value for the $$$, better quality than Harbor Freight for sure. Home Depot sells it online
customer_reviews.author: Mr. MomTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Really a great kit for nailing any pieces of wood together.
customer_reviews.text: Used all nail guns to construct a dog ramp up to the bed. Every tool was solid and got nails in all the way into 2x4 and plywood. The staple gun was great for attaching the carpet onto the 2x4s and plywood. Made the job go very fast. Cant wait to try it for building a deck and framing the basement.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Pap pap pap! This is fun.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used the framing nailer yet, since I haven't had to frame anything, but the rest work well. This is my first set of nail guns, been using them for about six months, as a very handy/DIY-minded homeowner, and couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: sb

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Value & Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great deal on a nail gun set. I have used the framing nailer, finish nailer and stapler to build an 8x12' storage shed from scratch with absolutely no jams or issues whatsoever. These appear to be very good quality tools at a great price. These work fine with the 3.5 gallon pancake compressor that I also purchased from amazon ( Do not hesitate to buy if you think you need a good framing and finish nailer. The brad nailer and stapler are a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Chris232

customer_reviews.title: but the standard kicked out of the way on a job site seems to be fine. Cons -can't fire the last 2 nails in ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid guns so far. Pros -Reliable, at least no issue yet. -Durable, not that I've dropped them, but the standard kicked out of the way on a job site seems to be fine. Cons -can't fire the last 2 nails in a clip -not great at angling a nail, though after 500 nails I've gotten better at predicting where they will end up.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: For someone who occasionally builds or fixes things these are perfect. I've used all guns twice now for hours at a time and they worked without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product. I got them to renovate my 1908 ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. I got them to renovate my 1908 house and they have become essential for many projects. It comes with a little goody bag full of stuff (allen keys, little bottle of oil, and other accessories). I like the storage bag that it comes with. It has ample room to store brads and staples. They seem well built and suit my needs. I am not using them everyday, but when I typically line up projects for a weekend the get used pretty regularly. I have no doubt that they will last.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger4

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 1 hour of use.
customer_reviews.text: Really bad quality just got started with project and the finishing nail gun's trigger broke. Now what?? Just another reminder to buy locally to support your hometown retailers.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: DIYers dream and amazing value!
customer_reviews.text: i normally don't ever remember to write reviews but i made sure to come back and write one for this product. So far i've only used the framing nailer as we're remodeling our home. it is INCREDIBLE for the price. I've got nearly 3,000 nails through it and it's never jammed once. I'm only a DIYer so i can't speak to heavy heavy daily use but for our fairly large project it's working incredibly well. I recommend this nailer to everyone. Once we get to finishing work I'll update about the other nailers.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Davies

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: They arrived a day earlier than i was told. I used these the same day. Works great, I am satisfied with this purchase. I have another brand with the hard case and the holding compartments have worn out. I appreciate the canvas bag that came with this and all the pockets it's much easier to handle.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: incredible value
customer_reviews.text: Just received and immediately put a handfull of fasteners through each of the tools. Each worked flawlessly. Comes in really nice, large bag for all of them, plus room for piles of fasteners and included spare parts. Bag gets pretty heavy. Comes with probably just a couple tablespoons of oil, so get more oil. Cant understand how they make any money on this set, with what you get for the money. Definitely recommend. Cant say anything about durability yet, but seems really solid and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Tacocat

customer_reviews.title: After a slight depth adjustment the framing nailer works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: After a slight depth adjustment the framing nailer works like a champ. Haven't tried the others but when I get the proper staples, pin nails and brad things I'll write another review on its worthiness. Works well, is bright orange and comes in a cool canvas carry bag
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Had my set 4 yrs barely use them went to load mails in 15 gauge brad mailer and metal ribbon came undone, useless save your money...
customer_reviews.author: jeff burke

customer_reviews.title: These units work very well!
customer_reviews.text: Hello it's an air tool. Make sure your pressure is set right and yes, do oil them each day you use them. With proper pressure they drive nails and staples with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly so far
customer_reviews.text: Bought the whole kit because I was installing trim after hardwood flooring. Pin nailer worked flawlessly. Cannot attest to long term durability or contracter grade
customer_reviews.author: John M. Ullrich

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: Really good value. I’m not a pro, but these thing make have handled every job I’ve thrown at it so far. Built a shed, shelves, trim, and a few other things. Can’t justify a $300 framing nailer, but this is an easy purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great price.  decent product
customer_reviews.text: All the guns work fine. The framing nailer doesn't fire when there is less than 4 nails left. Other than that for a cheap simple product everything works as well as you can expect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My husband was replacing boards are our privacy fence manually. Bought this product and he absolutely loves it. He said it saved his shoulders. We love that it has four different kinds of "nailers" if you will. Good product and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Great set for the home handy man!
customer_reviews.text: Though not as expensive as major brands & possibly not as durable in a commercial sense; they are a perfect match for the weekend carpenter & home handyman such as myself & many others. Serves nearly every need.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Horton

customer_reviews.title: Impressive  - so far
customer_reviews.text: Used the framing nailer so far. I'm impressed with the quality and ease of use so far. Excellent value for the money. I'm using Freeman nails, just to be sure. 2 Years later. Still going strong. I use the framing nailer most. Jams are rare and easy to clear.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Marshall

customer_reviews.title: happy of the buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an urgent need, but after I use it, I found I have made a right decision to buy this one. and happy to have it. very solid.
customer_reviews.author: Young

customer_reviews.title: SO far so good, i have only used the framing gun
customer_reviews.text: SO far so good, i have only used the framing gun, the others feel the same quality, its light enough, and has plenty of power. I have put about 100 nails through the gun so far, a few jams, mainly towards the end of the belt, as soon as you put another belt to push against it, its back one. good safety works great. Will review again when the others are used and may get 5 stars then.
customer_reviews.author: grease monkey

customer_reviews.title: good feeds, good power
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for building my deck. Given the price point was expecting less. What I got was a solid set of nailers. I have used all but the small brad gun. No problem with any of them. No jams, good feeds, good power, drives nails, finishing nails, and staples well. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Big Chill

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: They load easily. I've had no jams yet. I've put a few hundred nails through them, but I haven't used the framing nailer yet.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Good little guns ,,, not the best but works well if your not using them to make a living they will be great tool for you...
customer_reviews.author: Garth

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I use these guns a few times a week for installing windows, interior and exterior trim, jamb and casing, I have not had any problems, they work very well!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Ferrin

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Bought these with low expectations but they have exceeded expectations!! Work well with no issues!! Would recommend to anyone looking for a set for the weekend do it yourselfer!!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn warren

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a good price!
customer_reviews.text: Great value and great product! Definitely recommend for other buyers!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Dan Golfin

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money, but know what you're getting.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad nail gun set. Haven't used the framing gun yet, tho. Also, just be aware that the brad nailer and stapler only accept sizes up to 1-1/4". I have never seen an 18 gauge pinner that wouldn't accept up to 2 inch or longer brads. Should have read the fine print! Sometimes while doing trim work it's beneficial and even necessary to be able to drive a longer brad. The one that's included in the trimmer set from Freeman can handle longer nails, not sure why this one can't. Overall, though, a decent set, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J McLeod

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected. Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Great value. Didn't expect much for this price but was blown away. I am a contractor and use them almost daily. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Simons

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I have only used the 15 gauge finish nailer, and the 18 gauge brad nailer. I bought the nails manufactured by the same company. But I found inserting the angle finish nail was not smooth, and I had to force it in. I posted a question and it seems others didn't have the problem based on the answers. The piece I got might be a defective one I guess. Since I needed it urgently I didn't bother to exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Rishi

customer_reviews.title: Freeman 4piece air tool kit, with canvas bag.
customer_reviews.text: Framing gun did not last long, used it for the second time today and if failed, blowing air straight through the gun, of course its to late to complain, I've had it just about a year, maybe I should have bought the extended warranty, should have bought the cheap one from Harbor Freight. Will not buy any tools from Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had no problems with them
customer_reviews.text: Looks really good and has worked great, haven’t put them through a lot so don’t know how they’d hold up on job sites, but using them periodically couldn’t have been better for me
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for a handy man
customer_reviews.text: I am finishing my basement and I got these to do my framing,.... They are awesome for the price. All of me tools are dewalt and good stuff. But I didn't want to pay 4 seperate $120 or so. So instead I bought this pack. It works perfect as long as you oil them properly. I am so happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy shopper

customer_reviews.title: Awesome set!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to give them a try. Im used to high end hitachis and what not but i got say i like these guns. I dont do construction for a living anymore and these hold up to any porject or renevation i do on the side. Id def buy them again although i couldnt find finish nails at my local lumber store. No big deal with amazon prime. I can have them over nighted for like 7$ and save mes gas and time
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Only used the framing gun so far and it works great. I used a six gallon compressor but I recommend a larger one due to time needed to pressurize the tank for continuous use.
customer_reviews.author: Grady Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: The framing nailer works as it should, but it wastes the last 3 to 4 nails in every clip. The other guns aren't much better at this. It is a pity, as that makes it an expensive issue for those who intend to fire a lot of nails
customer_reviews.author: KAS

customer_reviews.title: Beware of significant price drops
customer_reviews.text: So far I've just used the framer and the finishing gun, but I have been very pleased with the quality thus far and the purchase overall. These will only see homeowner use, so I'm confident these will do the job. However, I was not pleased when the price dropped $50 a month after my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: Good nailer and great price.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a framing nailer and a finishing nailer that is longer than my 2" one. I found this and for the price decided to get it. It seems most of the other framing nail guns use 30 degree nails not 21 but I did find the nails at Lowe's. So for the really like the finishing nail gun with the 2 1/2" nails. I already had and smaller ones but now I have some back up ones.
customer_reviews.author: RetDetSgt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent nailer gun
customer_reviews.text: We are remodeling an old house and had to have a nailer gun. This one fit my purposes perfectly. It is a little on the heavy side but all nailers are. Does great and havent had any problems out of it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome DIY kit!
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit worried as I've never heard of this brand, but am very pleased with the quality and performance! And you simply cannot beat the price. I don't know how well these will hold up to contractor daily use, but for my project (entire home interior build), these are the ticket!
customer_reviews.author: Sky-Guy

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy for the cost and operation of the set!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Used 3 of the 4 so far and have been very happy! Yes you do have a few misfires, but most of the time it's operator error. I've put 5000 nails through the Framing gun 2500 2 1/2" ring shank & 2500 3 1/2" ring shank nails with no issues. About 1500 finish nails through the finish nailer, which misfires easier due to the feed spring (operator error mostly) and 500 staples through staple gun! Main complaints would be framer is heavy and no clip on it to hook it on belt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great guns.
customer_reviews.text: Good trio of guns, have put 5000 nails through framing gun and it is a beast, haven't had a jam. The other two work just as well. Well pleased.
customer_reviews.author: sldmsen2

customer_reviews.title: Good  buy!
customer_reviews.text: Been using these to build my 8 ft privacy fence and my three rail split rail fence. Three drops of oil every time I break them out, runs like a champ. Been using Metabo (formally Mitsubishi) nails and they have not missed a beat.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth cash

customer_reviews.title: great for price I am a building contractor and use ...
customer_reviews.text: great for price I am a building contractor and use them for extra guys on site and I use my high end guns myself
customer_reviews.author: Donald Lomnicky

customer_reviews.title: I nailed it!
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this was an excellent buy. The framing nailer is big and packs a punch. The other nailers are good quality and Freeman backs their products with a seven year warranty. Comes with canvas bag.
customer_reviews.author: J Ayers

customer_reviews.title: Used just one gun so far for a few projects ...
customer_reviews.text: Used just one gun so far for a few projects so far, it has saved me a lot of time, frustration and for the price it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how sturdy and lightweight these are! It's not because they're cheap, it's because they use magnesium blocks! Magnesium is stronger than steel by weight and very expensive for a reason. I can't believe I only paid what I did for these. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Radford

product_meta.title: Freeman P4FRFNCB Pneumatic Framing & Finishing Combo Kit with Canvas Bag (4Piece) Nail Gun Set with Framing Nailer, Finish Nailer, Brad Nailer, & Narrow Crown Stapler
product_meta.description: Style:Combo kitThe Freeman P4FRFNCB Pneumatic Framing and Finishing Nailers and Stapler Combo Kit with Canvas Bag (4-Piece) is an essential set of tools for professional construction contractors at the job site as well as DIYers tackling home improvement and repair projects. This collection of air powered nail guns and a stapler covers your framing to finishing needs and includes a 21 degree 3-1/2" Full Round Head Framing Nailer (PFR2190), 15-Gauge 34 Degree Angle 2-1/2" Finish Nailer (PFN1564), 18-Gauge 1-1/4" Brad Nailer (PBR32), and 18-Gauge 1-1/4" Narrow Crown Stapler (PST9032). The powerful framing nailer is specifically designed for tasks such as framing, sheathing, truss assembly, roof decking, subfloors, fencing, furniture, and assembling pallets and shipping crates. This durable nail gun features a one piece drive blade made of hardened steel and a lightweight magnesium body. Put the finish nailer to work on door and window casing, moulding, trim, chair rails, cabinetry, and other fine finish applications. The 34 degree angle of the magazine makes it easy to access corners or tight spaces, and the dual mode trigger allows to easily switch between sequential or bump firing. When the focus is on accuracy, use the sequential mode. When speed is the name of the game, engage the bump fire option and get to work. The brad nailer is ideal for interior and exterior finish and trim, furniture, cabinetry, picture frame assembly, and hobbies and crafts. An oil-free design eliminates the need for regular maintenance and prevents stains on your work surface. The narrow crown stapler is perfect for projects such as decorative trim, cabinetry, cabinet backing, and hobbies and crafts. The no mar safety tip prevents damage to your work surface, ensuring professional results. A canvas carrying bag, air tool oil, and adjustment tools are included. The Pneumatic Framing and Finishing Nailers and Stapler Combo Kit with Canvas Bag (4-Piece) will allow you to complete a wide variety of home improvement and repair projects quickly and easily.
feature_bullets: Powerful Combo: This kit features 4 of Freeman's most useful pneumatic nailers to cover all your framing and finishing needs: a framing nailer, a finish nailer, a straight brad nailer, and a narrow crown stapler. The kit includes a rugged canvas carrying bag.

Heavy Duty and Fine Detail: The nailers included in this combo kit are ideal for everything from heavy duty work like subfloors, roof decking, fencing, and pallet building to fine detail work like cabinetry, crown moulding, window casings, base boards, and trim.

The Right Tool for the Job: We're committed to providing outstanding value, top tier customer service and long lasting, high quality products. We make nailers and staplers for every purpose, from roofing to siding to flooring and everything in between.

Quality and Durability: We manufacture tools with the most durable materials under strict quality control guidelines, suitable for professional contractors and do-it-yourselfers alike. Our tools are sold, distributed, serviced, and warrantied in the USA.

Tough and Dependable: We make an array of durable construction tools and accessories, including staplers and nailers for siding, flooring, framing, finish, and roofing. Compare our products to similar items by Makita, Hitachi, Bostitch, Senco, Paslode, and Dewalt.

specifications.Included Components: 21 Degree 3-1/2" Full Round Head Framing Nailer
specifications.Warranty Description: 7 Year Limited Warranty and 90 Day Wearable Parts Warranty
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars773 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
